definition: Initial Coin Offering. A fundraising method that trades future crypto coins for cryptocurrencies which have an immediate, liquid value.

A unit of value that an organization creates to self-govern its business model, and empower its users to interact with its products, while facilitating the distribution and sharing of rewards and benefits to all of its stakeholders.
A document prepared by an INCO project team before the INCO launch. It outlines the project, the technology behind it, the purpose and the team.

A self-executing contract with the terms of the agreement between buyer and seller being directly written into lines of code. The code and the agreements contained therein exist across a distributed, decentralized blockchain network.
A standard for fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. ERC stands for Ethereum Request for Comment, and 20 is the number that was assigned to this request.
A standard for non-fungible tokens on the Ethereum blockchain. ERC stands for Ethereum Request for Comment, and 721 is the number that was assigned to this request.
A system where the decision-making power is distributed and not held by a single entity.
A system where the decision-making power is held by a single entity.
A decentralized, distributed ledger that records the provenance of a digital asset.
A digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security.
A good or asset is fungible if individual units are interchangeable.
A good or asset is non-fungible if individual units are not interchangeable.
The process of adding transaction records to a blockchain.
